strapiArticle.title: Silog
strapiArticle.description: This is a classic Filipino breakfast.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 2 cups cooked Jasmine rice
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
  • 4 eggs

Your choice of meat (tapa, tocino, longganisa, or bangus) Salt and pepper to taste Optional toppings: sliced tomatoes, cucumber, or atchara (pickled papaya)

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the meat: If using tapa, tocino, or longganisa, follow the package instructions for cooking. If using bangus, you can grill or fry it until cooked through. Set aside.

  2. Heat the vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and saut√© until golden brown and fragrant.

  3. Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir-fry with the garlic for a few minutes, ensuring the rice is well coated with the garlic-infused oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.

  4. In the same pan, fry the eggs according to your preference (sunny side up or over easy).

  5. To serve, place a portion of the garlic fried rice on a plate. Add your choice of meat beside the rice and top it off with a fried egg.

  6. Garnish with your preferred toppings, such as sliced tomatoes, cucumber, or atchara (pickled papaya).

  7. Repeat the process for each serving.

  8. Enjoy your delicious Silog breakfast while it's still warm!

Note: You can adjust the quantities of rice, garlic, and eggs depending on your preference and the number of servings you wish to make. Feel free to add other side dishes or sauces, such as vinegar or soy sauce, to enhance the flavors according to your taste.
